value: The Roman Empire withdrew from Britain around AD 410.

patches.reasoning: Addressed common misconceptions about the end of Roman Britain.

value.misconception: The Romans left Britain because they were defeated by the Britons
value.description: The Romans left due to pressures elsewhere in the Empire, not due to defeat in Britain. Discuss the political and military reasons for their departure.

value.misconception: All Roman structures disappeared immediately after they left
value.description: Explain that while many Roman structures fell into disuse, some remained and were repurposed over time.
